definition: to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: In male flowers, style cells containing no calcium precipitation soon began to degenerate.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏钙沉淀颗粒的雄花花柱细胞迅速解体。

sentences.english: The main factors influencing precipitation of electrophoretic coatings and their solving methods are given in this article.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了影响电泳漆沉淀的主要因素和采取的对策。

sentences.english: Commercial scale test of selective precipitation method for Mo removal from tungstate solution;
sentences.chinese: 研究了用硫酸铜沉淀法除去粗钨酸钠溶液中钼的方法。

sentences.english: Calcium precipitates in style cell and vascular tissues of male flowers was sparse and seldom seen.
sentences.chinese: 雄花花柱细胞和维管细胞中钙沉淀颗粒很少。

sentences.english: Stir the coffee to settle the grounds .
sentences.chinese: 把咖啡搅一搅好让渣滓沉淀。

sentences.english: A honey character, from lees contact, gives the wine depth.
sentences.chinese: 酒渣沉淀后获取的蜜汁，赋予了其丰富的酒体。

sentences.english: Barium carbonate was prepared by using common precipitation method.
sentences.chinese: 采用共沉淀法合成了碳酸钡粒子。

sentences.english: In this method the interference come from inorganic sulfide was removed by Copper acetate homogenous precipitation met…
sentences.chinese: 水中无机硫化物的干扰用乙酸铜均匀沉淀法去除。

sentences.english: This precipitated a syncretistic controversy that was to last for many years.
sentences.chinese: 这沉淀一融的争议，这是持续了很多年。

sentences.english: It is revealed that in double diffusion and immunoelectrophoresis the product yielded a single precipitating line.
sentences.chinese: 以双扩及免疫电泳鉴定，均呈现单一沉淀线。

sentences.english: The plasma sample was directly injected for determination after being deproteinized with perchloric acid.
sentences.chinese: 血浆样品用高氯酸沉淀蛋白后直接进样。

sentences.english: Methods Polysaccharides of Codium fragile were extracted by using hot water extraction and ethanol precipitation.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用热水浸提乙醇沉淀法制备刺松藻多糖。

sentences.english: The dregs settled and the liquid became clear.
sentences.chinese: 渣滓沉淀下来，液体变清了。

sentences.english: To forge the obscure into 2D images, while sludging through the cultural molasses.
sentences.chinese: 从模糊建立到二维图像，而通过文化糖蜜沉淀。

sentences.english: The rough extract of Pinggu mushroom PPO was obtained by ammonium sulfate precipitation method.
sentences.chinese: 采用硫酸铵沉淀法得到平菇多酚氧化酶粗提液。

sentences.english: Low spreading angles of the turbulent jet restrict the lateral dispersion of sediment particles.
sentences.chinese: 乱流小地分布规模限制啦沉淀粒子在侧面地分布。

definition: deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
to accumulate over a long period of time
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
to concentrate (a liquid)/concentration/espresso coffee/abbr. for 意式濃縮咖啡|意式浓缩咖啡
